programme.title: Game of the Week
programme.desc: Quarterback Jared Goff, running back Jahmyr Gibbs and wide receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown led Lions to a game-winning field goal to hand the Minnesota Vikings their first loss in a spectacular game resulting in a 31-29 Lions victory at U.S. Bank Stadium.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: Find out how innovative technology and cutting-edge data are powering the future of the NFL with Next Gen Stats.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: Get a behind-the-scenes look at the Kansas City Chiefs 2024 NFL Season.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: The greatest play from every year since 1980.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Relive the longest OT scores in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: Relive the sights, sounds and moments behind 2024 NFL regular season.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones had an impressive rookie season. See the best moments from his 22-TD, 3801-yard year.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New England Patriots had rookie QB Drake Maye back after being knocked out of last week's win over the Jets and used his legs, running for a career-best and team-high 95 yards. The Pats had a final chance after Maye forced overtime with a 5-yard TD pass to Rhamondre Stevenson, but Amani Hooker's second interception of the game clinched the victory for the Titans with 2:07 left.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jayden Daniels threw for 5 touchdowns, leading the Commanders to a thrilling 36-33 comeback win over the Eagles, ending their 10-game streak. Despite Hurts' early injury, Daniels' heroics secured the victory.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Derrick Henry busted out the longest run in the team's 29 years in Baltimore on the way to a 199-yard game, Lamar Jackson threw for two touchdowns and rushed for another, and the Ravens handed Josh Allen and the Bills their first loss of the season, 35-10 on Sunday night.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: It's time to unwrap the history of NFL rivalries and the divisions that helped create so many of them. Sit back and watch all the craziest, most heated moments that have led to so much ill will between teams and their fans.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Jordan Love and Green Bay Packers outduel quarterback Caleb Williams and the Chicago Bears with help from a blocked field goal as time expired.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen's touchdown on fourth-and-2 with 2:17 left sealed Buffalo's 30-21 victory, kept the Bills (9-2) in contention for the AFC's top seed and spoiled the two-time defending Super Bowl champion Chiefs' bid for a perfect season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rams stage comeback and rally back to beat the Seahawks 17-16. Matthew Stafford leads late charge after tough hit and Geno Smith's injury stalls Seahawks' momentum. Defense seals win with key interceptions.

programme.title: NFL Explained: Making of the Schedule
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the complicated process involved in creating an NFL season schedule.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Find out every NFL team's biggest win and most embarrassing defeat of the Super Bowl era.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: A look back at the history of international games in the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Check out the greatest plays from international games in NFL history.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Follow Odell Beckham Jr.'s trip to Germany to spread America's Game internationally. OBJ hangs with Bayern Munich, his German fans, the Munich Cowboys, dives into German lederhosen and food culture. Odell then takes a trip to London, where he talks about his sudden fame on Sky Sports and has some fun on the pitch with F2Freestylers and KSI.

programme.title: NFL Going Global: Edelman & Amendola in Mexico City
programme.desc: Super Bowl champions Julian Edelman and Danny Amendola venture to Mexico City to fully experience one of the most vibrant cities on earth and some of the world's most passionate and inspiring NFL fans.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Justin Jefferson was an NFL ambassador in Brazil, with soccer great Vinicius Jr. as his tour guide.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Cam Jordan explores Spain to visit the Basque Derby, rural games including Basque Hand-Pelota Spanish Handball, learning about the food, and spreading the word of American Football.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: Everything that goes into preparing a stadium for the first NFL game in Germany.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady and the Buccaneers beat the Seahawks 21-16 in the first regular-season game played in Munich, Germany.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Bryce Young passed for three touchdowns, ran for two scores and led a 70-yard drive capped by Miles Sanders' 1-yard TD run on the opening possession of overtime to give Carolina a 44-38 win over Atlanta.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: A look back at the history of international games in the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Check out the greatest plays from international games in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Sam Darnold leads the Minnesota Vikings to 5-0 in London against Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets in London, 23-17. Rodgers threw 3 INT's on the day before getting twisted up awkwardly while getting tackled by several Vikings defenders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley scored three touchdowns Friday night in the first NFL game in Sao Paulo, Brazil and led the Eagles to a 34-29 victory over the Green Bay Packers, who lost quarterback Jordan Love to an injury in the closing seconds.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: Kahuku HS wins a state championship in honor of fallen coaches and their Polynesian heritage.

programme.title: Game of the Week
programme.desc: Quarterback Jared Goff, running back Jahmyr Gibbs and wide receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown led Lions to a game-winning field goal to hand the Minnesota Vikings their first loss in a spectacular game resulting in a 31-29 Lions victory at U.S. Bank Stadium.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: Find out how innovative technology and cutting-edge data are powering the future of the NFL with Next Gen Stats.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: Get a behind-the-scenes look at the Kansas City Chiefs 2024 NFL Season.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: The greatest play from every year since 1980.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Relive the longest OT scores in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: Relive the sights, sounds and moments behind 2024 NFL regular season.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones had an impressive rookie season. See the best moments from his 22-TD, 3801-yard year.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New England Patriots had rookie QB Drake Maye back after being knocked out of last week's win over the Jets and used his legs, running for a career-best and team-high 95 yards. The Pats had a final chance after Maye forced overtime with a 5-yard TD pass to Rhamondre Stevenson, but Amani Hooker's second interception of the game clinched the victory for the Titans with 2:07 left.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jayden Daniels threw for 5 touchdowns, leading the Commanders to a thrilling 36-33 comeback win over the Eagles, ending their 10-game streak. Despite Hurts' early injury, Daniels' heroics secured the victory.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Derrick Henry busted out the longest run in the team's 29 years in Baltimore on the way to a 199-yard game, Lamar Jackson threw for two touchdowns and rushed for another, and the Ravens handed Josh Allen and the Bills their first loss of the season, 35-10 on Sunday night.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: It's time to unwrap the history of NFL rivalries and the divisions that helped create so many of them. Sit back and watch all the craziest, most heated moments that have led to so much ill will between teams and their fans.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Jordan Love and Green Bay Packers outduel quarterback Caleb Williams and the Chicago Bears with help from a blocked field goal as time expired.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen's touchdown on fourth-and-2 with 2:17 left sealed Buffalo's 30-21 victory, kept the Bills (9-2) in contention for the AFC's top seed and spoiled the two-time defending Super Bowl champion Chiefs' bid for a perfect season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rams stage comeback and rally back to beat the Seahawks 17-16. Matthew Stafford leads late charge after tough hit and Geno Smith's injury stalls Seahawks' momentum. Defense seals win with key interceptions.

programme.title: NFL Explained: Making of the Schedule
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the complicated process involved in creating an NFL season schedule.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Find out every NFL team's biggest win and most embarrassing defeat of the Super Bowl era.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: A look back at the history of international games in the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Check out the greatest plays from international games in NFL history.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Follow Odell Beckham Jr.'s trip to Germany to spread America's Game internationally. OBJ hangs with Bayern Munich, his German fans, the Munich Cowboys, dives into German lederhosen and food culture. Odell then takes a trip to London, where he talks about his sudden fame on Sky Sports and has some fun on the pitch with F2Freestylers and KSI.

programme.title: NFL Going Global: Edelman & Amendola in Mexico City
programme.desc: Super Bowl champions Julian Edelman and Danny Amendola venture to Mexico City to fully experience one of the most vibrant cities on earth and some of the world's most passionate and inspiring NFL fans.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Justin Jefferson was an NFL ambassador in Brazil, with soccer great Vinicius Jr. as his tour guide.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Cam Jordan explores Spain to visit the Basque Derby, rural games including Basque Hand-Pelota Spanish Handball, learning about the food, and spreading the word of American Football.

programme.title: NFL Explained
programme.desc: Everything that goes into preparing a stadium for the first NFL game in Germany.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Tom Brady and the Buccaneers beat the Seahawks 21-16 in the first regular-season game played in Munich, Germany.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Bryce Young passed for three touchdowns, ran for two scores and led a 70-yard drive capped by Miles Sanders' 1-yard TD run on the opening possession of overtime to give Carolina a 44-38 win over Atlanta.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: A look back at the history of international games in the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: Check out the greatest plays from international games in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Sam Darnold leads the Minnesota Vikings to 5-0 in London against Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets in London, 23-17. Rodgers threw 3 INT's on the day before getting twisted up awkwardly while getting tackled by several Vikings defenders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley scored three touchdowns Friday night in the first NFL game in Sao Paulo, Brazil and led the Eagles to a 34-29 victory over the Green Bay Packers, who lost quarterback Jordan Love to an injury in the closing seconds.

programme.title: Robert MacIntyre Wins RBC Canadian Open
programme.desc: Robert MacIntyre captures his first PGA TOUR victory after his win at the 2024 RBC Canadian Open. MacIntyre carded rounds of 64-66-66-68 to finish 16-under at Hamilton Golf & Country Club.

programme.title: Hideki Matsuyama Wins FedEx St. Jude
programme.desc: Olympic bronze medalist Hideki Matsuyama captures his 10th PGA TOUR victory after winning the 2024 FedEx St. Jude Championship. This is his second win of the 2024 FedExCup Season.

programme.title: Davis Riley Wins Charles Schwab Challenge
programme.desc: Davis Riley wins the 2024 Charles Schwab Challenge to get his first solo win on the PGA TOUR. Riley's last win was at the 2023 Zurich Classic with teammate Nick Hardy. Riley shot rounds of 66-64-66-70 to finish 14-under par.

programme.title: Chris Gotterup Wins Myrtle Beach Classic
programme.desc: Chris Gotterup captures his first PGA TOUR victory after his win at the 2024 Myrtle Beach Classic. Gotterup shot rounds of 66-64-65-67 to finish 22-under to win the inaugural event.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top Ten Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #14 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show on TLN! Draft insider Adam Lamberti joints the show to get us ready for next weeks PLL Draft. Hoagie and Doogs go at it again. No tramp stamp for Hoagie as Michigan falls to Rutgers in the Big 10 quarters, as he predicted. Are Hopkins and Cuse's coaches seats heating up a bit? Mitch talks about "other" programs that are starting to catch up. Kev rounds it out with a new segment for the boys.

Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #14 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show on TLN! Draft insider Adam Lamberti joints the show to get us ready for next weeks PLL Draft. Hoagie and Doogs go at it again. No tramp stamp for Hoagie as Michigan falls to Rutgers in the Big 10 quarters, as he predicted. Are Hopkins and Cuse's coaches seats heating up a bit? Mitch talks about "other" programs that are starting to catch up. Kev rounds it out with a new segment for the boys.

programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.desc: After finally moving into their dream home together, a young couple finds that theyre being watched every night by an obsessed neighbor.

programme.title: The Honeymoon
programme.desc: Humiliated by her best friend and ex-fianc's affair, Summer seeks revenge by sabotaging their honeymoon, but her plan unravels.

programme.title: Sex and the Single Lady
programme.desc: NY Times bestselling author/party girl, Tamia, plays as hard as she works; she's learned how to manipulate men and use them for her every desire. It's all fun and games until one pawn changes the rules with deadly consequences.

programme.title: Sex and the Single Lady 2
programme.desc: Tamia, Kai, Petra and Ebony face challenges that put their friendship to the test when the ties that once bonded them are broken.

programme.title: Magic
programme.desc: A young man who grew up in the ghetto in Chicago finds success in the film and music industry.

programme.title: Lacee
programme.desc: A hot, up-and-coming, all-female R&B group embarks on a journey of sex, power and music business betrayal on their road to the big time.

programme.title: Killer Baby Mama
programme.desc: Calvin and Erica's tumultuous relationship takes a turn when Erica discovers she's pregnant. Unhappy with the news, Calvin decides to break up with her, moving on to date Candace. Meanwhile, Erica befriends Calvin's sick mother to gather information.

programme.title: Intrigue
programme.desc: Jessica and Darren's marriage has hit a rocky stage in their lives. When a mysterious man named Michael enters her life, Jessica is intrigued explores options that could have deadly consequences.

programme.title: Hidden Agenda
programme.desc: When a popular football star dies after an after party, a woman goes on the hunt to find his killer.

programme.title: Grimy Situation
programme.desc: After spending 15 years in prison, Camille Sanders is forced to decide between her new life or returning to her old ways.

programme.title: Heavy
programme.desc: A young man changes his lifes focus, but this newfound path leads him to a place where he must now choose between love and loyalty.

programme.title: Flew'd Out
programme.desc: Tiara is a social media influencer who goes viral after posting a video of a fallout between her and a man she was dating. In an attempt to keep up her social media momentum, Tiara accepts an invitation to be flown out to meet a man named Josiah.

programme.title: But I'm Married
programme.desc: Kimora, a top home designer, and Jamal, a construction mogul, tackle the twists of marriage and temptation in their bustling careers.

programme.title: Shotlanta
programme.desc: Mozzy moves from Jamaica to Atlanta, rising in the drug trade to lift his family from poverty, but faces challenges that test his loyalty.

programme.title: Boyz for Life
programme.desc: Two detectives pursue an international criminal who stole Escobar's stash from the LAPD, swapping identities to protect a witness.

programme.title: Taboo 3: The Unforgettable Act
programme.desc: When Devin finally meets his soap star birth mother as an adult, feelings go beyond family love.

programme.title: Sweet Revenge
programme.desc: Gianna will never forget the day her father was killed. Years later, she finds the murderer back in her life.

programme.title: Romeo and Isabella
programme.desc: Trans woman Isabella has always struggled to find the right man, until she returns to her hometown and falls for the neighborhood bad boy.

programme.title: Queen of the Trap House
programme.desc: The girlfriend of a jailed drug kingpin hesitates when asked to take over as Queen of the trap house, but finds shes better at it than she thought.

programme.title: Mahogany
programme.desc: Mo, a young woman growing up in the trenches of an urban neighborhood, faces drugs, crime, violence, and poverty. All become driving factors that will test Mo's decision to rise above her circumstances as danger grows beyond her control.

programme.title: Kill Em With a Smile
programme.desc: A dying woman finds that the only thing that scares her more than her own death is her husband finding a new person to spend his days with.

programme.title: Ice
programme.desc: A young man sets out for revenge against the ruthless gangsters who killed his parents, only to fall for the crime lords daughter.

programme.title: Induced 2
programme.desc: A couple hires a new midwife, only to be stalked by a crazed woman who will stop at nothing in her attempt to steal their new baby.

programme.title: The Housekeeper
programme.desc: After the murder of her son, grief-stricken Sharease takes a job as a housekeeper and becomes a lover to a man she learns was a local crime boss.

programme.title: Vanity Flaw
programme.desc: After losing a bet, Mallory dances at a strip club for one night, only to encounter a kidnapper with a dangerous obsession and a violent temper.

programme.title: Against All Odds
programme.desc: David, a young man reeling from his brother's death and his family's financial ruin, finds himself adrift. Rejected by his father, he turns to a local criminal for quick cash, only to find himself trapped in a dangerous web of deceit and violence. Now, David must fight to escape and protect his family before it's too late. The clock is ticking, and the stakes are higher than ever.

programme.title: The Isiah Factor Uncensored
programme.desc: News anchor and reporter Isiah Carey tackles hot-button news issues with a no-holds-barred attitude.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqu, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Divorce Court
programme.desc: Renada thinks her fianc is living a double life; she's done being lied to, and if the polygraph test shows he's been cheating, she's calling off the wedding.

programme.title: Late Night Love
programme.desc: Your live, late-night destination for real talk on love, sex, and relationships.

programme.title: The Listening Lounge
programme.desc: 150 self-care exercises to help Black women boost mental health, ease stress, and self-advocate.

programme.title: Faceoff on Fox Soul

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: The Westerner
programme.desc: Accused of stealing horses, drifter Cole Harden (Gary Cooper) finds himself before the infamous Judge Roy Bean (Walter Brennan). Aware of the judge's affection for actress Lily Langtree (Lilian Bond), Cole claims to know her and thus receives a suspended sentence. Soon after, Cole falls for an attractive homesteader (Doris Davenport) whose father (Fred Stone) is indirectly killed by Bean's henchmen. Looking for revenge, Cole tracks the judge to a theater where Langtree is set to perform.

programme.title: The Hanging Tree
programme.desc: Joseph "Doc" Frail (Gary Cooper) is a doctor with a past he's trying to outrun. While in Montana, he comes across a mining camp with a hanging tree and rescues a man named Rune (Ben Piazza) from the noose. With Rune as his servant, Frail decides to settle down, and he takes over as town doctor. He meets Elizabeth (Maria Schell), who is suffering from shock, and the two soon fall in love. But when Elizabeth is attacked, Frail's attempt to help her lands them both in trouble.

programme.title: Along Came Jones
programme.desc: Melody Jones (Gary Cooper) is a laid-back cowboy who gets lost on the trail and ends up in the small town of Payneville. Seeing the initials "MJ" on his saddle, the people of Payneville mistake Jones for the treacherous bandit Monte Jarrad (Dan Duryea), and they nearly kill him before he is rescued by Cherry de Longpre (Loretta Young). Grateful for her help, Jones falls for de Cherry, not knowing that she is Jarrad's girl and that she plans on using him to help Jarrad elude capture.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tylers approach.

programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.desc: With tremendous wit and sarcasm, Mike, Servo and Crow lambaste this cinematic stinker, which focuses on women's wrestling promoter Scalli, a dirty scoundrel involved in illegal gambling who tries to run away from the cops and brutal mobsters.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Girl in Gold Boots" (1968) Crime drama; A draft dodger works as a janitor in Hollywood while his girlfriend goes into go-go dancing.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Tormented, jazz pianist Tom Stewart, soon to marry the woman he loves, watches former love Vi Mason fall from a lighthouse and does not save her. Vis spirit returns and begins to torment Tom at his every step.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Rocket Attack, U.S.A." (1959) Science fiction. A U.S. spy's presence in Moscow spells nuclear doom for Manhattan. With Monica Davis, John MacKay, Daniel Kern.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew watch an education short about the wonders a home economics major can do for young women in 1951's "The Home Economics Story"; lonely viking women set sail to rescue a group of enslaved men in 1957's "The Saga of the Viking Women and their Voyage to the Waters of the Great Sea Serpent"; Joel and the Bots consider the waffle, and present an iron that can turn waffles into pancakes at the invention exchange.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Village of the Giants." (1965) Science fiction. Teens eat boy-genius's food, grow big and bad; with Johnny Crawford, Ronny Howard.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Robot vs. the Aztec Mummy" (1959) Horror. Mad Dr. Krupp sends his homemade robot to rob the treasure of a Mexican mummy's tomb. With Ramon Gay, Rosita Arenas, Crox Alvarado.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Horrors of Spider Island" (1960) Horror. A plane crashes on a remote island teeming with lethal spiders. With Harald Maresch and Helga Franck.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Hillbillys in a Haunted House
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew roast this 1967 redneck romp with a cardigan-clad Merle Haggard lookalike and a lead whos not built for sneaking around corners.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gorgo" (1961) Science Fiction. Monster wrecks London landmarks to free her baby.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Survivors of devastation enter the Power Station to fight the Dark One after billions of robots revolt against humans on New Terra.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Samson vs. the Vampire Women" (1961) Horror. The silver-masked Mexican wrestler refuses to submit.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The guys watch a 1950s teen flick about youths sentenced to manual labor at a cotton farm.

programme.title: The Film Crew: Killers From Space
programme.desc: The Film Crew continue their thankless task of reviewing the best worst movies with the 1954 sci-fi stinker Killers from Space.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000: Shorts
programme.desc: What is being done today to create the chicken of tomorrow; how important gas stations and oil are to the poultry industry.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Prisoners of the Lost Universe
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew teleports into a parallel world of sword and sorcery with a handyman and journalist who try to groin-kick their way back to Earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A bizarre ocean creature spreads panic throughout Florida after a botched scientific experiment in "Devilfish.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Wild Rebels" (1967) Action. An auto racer poses as getaway driver for outlaw bikers. With Steve Alaimo, Willie Pastrano, John Vella.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 20 junior home cooks face an out-of-this-world Mystery Box challenge with special guest astronaut Tracy Dyson, during which they must prepare a unique dish that highlights a stellar ingredient. The one who rockets to the top will have a significant advantage in the elimination challenge, when the contestants will be tasked with creating a stunning and delicious fish dish in order to move onto the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, the remaining 18 junior home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season and the first-ever MASTERCHEF JUNIOR team relay race. Each team must create a large serving of seven-layer dip. The team that completes the dip first will be safe from the next elimination challenge, and choose the smelly, wrinkly or spicy ingredients for that challenge. Find out who will smell their way to victory and who will dip lower in the competition.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mike and Nellie's in New Jersey. With its putrid pasta sauces, overcooked shrimp plates, smelly carpets and dirty kitchen, Ramsay steps in to rejuvenate the joint.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Greek at the Harbor is on the verge of closing. It's up to Chef Ramsay to save the waterfront venue by improving the menu, the dated d_cor and the relationship between its owners.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams participate in a "Hell's Kitchen craps" challenge. The winners take a private jet to Las Vegas and stay at the Planet Hollywood resort and casino.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: After an impressive Bollywood dance performance, Ramsay challenges the chefs to make Indian cuisine. The winners get a spa day while the losers prepare for the dinner service.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The chefs take on southern cuisine with a twist.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants bake to win.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks will party their way into the next team challenge when they leave the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR kitchen for the first time to cook at a birthday party for kids ages 8-13, as well as special guests, the Ramsay and Elliot children. The team that receives the most votes from the birthday party attendees will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next pressure test and create the French dessert croquembouche.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks squeeze in a seven-minute team challenge, in which they must make a batch of raspberry mint lemonade for judge Christina Tosi to blind taste test. Tosi will decide which team has the best lemonade and is safe from elimination, while the losing team will compete in the next challenge, during which they must create a rad dish from a decade in which one of the judges was born.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay spends a week in Los Angeles in hopes of refining Burger Kitchens disappointing menu and subpar service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Finding little improvement, Chef Ramsay pushes for even more changes to the menu and staff at Burger Kitchen.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining contestants take the annual blind taste test. The winners enjoy a day of rest and relaxation at the Santa Monica Pier, while the losers clean the dorms and kitchens.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs must make two servings of their own amuse-bouche, which will be judged by Chef Ramsay and "Epicurious" editor in chief Tanya Steel.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordons dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of new ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbooks signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christinas favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.desc: In Anaheim, California, Chef Ramsay performs an extreme makeover on Luigi's. The Italian eatery faces management conflicts after the owner retires and leaves the business to his sons.

programme.desc: The remaining contestants take on steak. Ramsay, along with Omaha Steaks owners Bruce and Todd Simon, judge the meals based on appearance and eat them only if they look favorable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the borders at Longmeadow hit their stride, it's time to take stock of what's looking good and what needs replacing. Monty shares his tips on how to keep the display going all summer long. There's plenty to do on the vegetable plot too and things are looking promising in the fruit garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with maintaining his pond and gives advice on planting water lilies. He also gives tips on how to grow and plant herbaceous clematis as well as harvesting potatoes. Nick Bailey begins his guide to demystifying roses, Arit Anderson takes a trip on a canal boat to find out how volunteers are bringing plants and wildlife back into the city of Birmingham, Mark Lane gives his guide on how to get the cottage style look into the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whether there is a heatwave or a downpour, Monty has plenty of jobs to be getting on with from pruning, propagating or planting pots. Adam Frost meets Prince Charles in his garden at Highgrove to talk about the issue of biosecurity, an issue which is of great concern to him and which could have a big effect on our gardens and landscape. Adam also talks to The Prince's Head Forester to find out what gardeners can do to help.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty advises on plants for a late summer display, tackles his overgrown wildlife pond and shows which roses to prune now for a repeat flowering in late summer. Frances Tophill travels to Birmingham where she shows that every space counts by transforming three tiny balconies into spaces full of colour and scent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of advice from pruning blackcurrants, taking cuttings and planting bulbs for flowering this Autumn. Carol Klein finds a collection of plants that are at their peak right now and gives her advice on how to grow one of the late summer garden stunners, the monarda while Adam Frost makes the finishing touches to the Leicestershire couple's garden which he helped them start from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rolls Royces, Tri-Five Chevys, and vintage Volkswagens

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 367K-mile Barracuda, short-bed F100, & Ford Cortina GT Wagon
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts down a interesting Ford F100 short-bed pickup before coming across a Plymouth Barracuda with an incredible 367,000 miles on the odometer. Next, Tom finds the last Ford Cortina GT Wagon along with a handful of other rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 700 Cars Hidden on Colorado Ranch

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel of All Things Hunting Scout, Prepare and Execute a late season duck hunt in a Cypress Break in the State of Louisiana. A successful duck hunt takes three things to accomplish, Great Gear, Hard Work, Finding where the ducks want to be, and this hunt has them all.

programme.title: Browning Films

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, its no different. With Winchesters in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at Johns lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interluxs paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Global Getaway

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. Its Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasnt affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers

This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.desc: Cameraman, Kyle gets behind the bow for a couple hunts in Kentucky and connects with his first buck in over 5 years.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
